III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health Services; Policies and Procedures
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/3/25, Youth A did not receive medical care following being
struck in the face by Youth F.
Investigation Complainant was contacted via phone on 3/5/2025. Complainant
did not provide any additional information regarding this allegation.
Along with MDHHS Specialist, an onsite interview was attempted
with Youth A and Youth F on 3/6/25. Upon arrival it was
disclosed that Youth A was AWOL. An onsite interview was
attempted on 3/13/25 during which time Youth A and Youth F
remained AWOL.
A face-to-face was attempted with Youth A by MDHHS Specialist
at the foster home placement on 3/19/25. Youth A declined to
speak about the facility or the incident and stated that he would
not speak with anyone regarding the matter.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Staff 1 reported that Youth A was
arguing back and forth with Youth E. Staff 1 did not recall what
was being said and reported that they were coming towards each
other so Staff 1 was monitoring and working to redirect the youths
verbally. Staff 1 reported that as staff’s attention was on Youth E,
Youth F walked up to Youth A and hit him. Staff 1 reported he did
not see the hit as he was facing Youth E at the time. Staff 1
reported that due to facing the other way he did not know if there
was injury or if a tooth was knocked out or broken. Staff 1 denied
seeing any blood. Staff 1 reported the incident was quick and
Youth A was immediately taken to the office. Staff 1 reported he
was not aware if Youth A received or declined to receive any
medical attention as he did not accompany him to the office or see
him following the incident.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Youth B reported he witnessed
Youth F hit Youth A in the face as he was walking into the room.
Youth B reported he did not know what they were fighting about
just that it was one punch, and it was broken up. Youth B reported
Youth A was escorted out of the area. Youth B reported he did not
2

know what occurred next, did not know if Youth A was seen by a
doctor or injured.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Youth C reported he witnessed the
altercation between Youth A and Youth F. Youth C reported Youth
F walked up to Youth A and punched him in the face. Youth C
reported the punch knocked out Youth A’s tooth. Youth C reported
after Youth A was hit he saw him run to the office. Youth C
reported Youth A then went AWOL. Youth C did not recall what
day Youth A went AWOL.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Youth D reported Youth F walked
up and punched Youth A in the face. Youth D reported the only
injury was Youth A lost a tooth. Youth D reported Youth A then
went to the office. Youth D reported he did not know if Youth A
went to a doctor.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Youth E reported Youth A said
something to him that made him mad. Youth E could not recall
what was said. Youth E reported they were standing there looking
at each other when Youth F came up and punched Youth A in the
face. Youth E reported he did not know why Youth F punched
Youth A. Youth E reported he did not know if Youth A was hurt.
Youth E reported he left the area at that time and did not know
what happened next. Youth E reported he did not know if Youth A
went to see a doctor.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 4/4/25. Staff 2 reported she
was made aware of the altercation afterwards as she was not
present. Staff 2 reported an incident report was completed.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 4/4/2025. Staff 3 reported
the initial incident was between Youth A and Youth E as they were
having words with each other. Staff 3 reported he did not recall
what was said or what they were arguing about but that he was
heading over and attempting to verbally deescalate the situation
by asking them to calm down. Staff 3 reported while he was facing
Youth E, Youth F came up and punched Youth A in the face. Staff
3 reported Youth A went straight to the office at that time. Staff 3
reported he heard from other staff that Youth A was refusing
medical care.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 4/4/2025. Staff 4 reported
she was present for the incident and was on the opposite end of
the room where Youth A and Youth E were having words. Staff 4
3

reported she walked with Youth A to the office to see NurseStaff 4
reported she did not know if Youth A refused medical care.
Nurse was interviewed via phone on 4/8/2025. Nurse reported
Youth A was escalated initially and did not wish to talk at first
following being struck in the face and entering the room with her.
Nurse reported she attempted to talk to him and help him calm
down. She said Youth A did not want to let anyone see his injury
at first but eventually let her see and she saw that his tooth was
broken. Nurse reported she attempted talking with him and telling
him he needed to go to the doctor, and he refused. Nurse reported
Youth A signed the necessary document refusing medical care
after a long discussion and several attempts to encourage him to
go.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Critical Incident Response and Reporting Policy. Policy
states that physical injury and AWOL incidents are
considered Critical Incidents. Policy states that reporting to
MDHHS is required within 24 hours.
• Incident Report dated 3/3/2025 documents that Youth F
assaulted Youth A by striking him in the face, causing his
tooth to be broken. Incident Report documents Youth A
refusing to go to urgent care. Incident report documents
contact at 3/4/25 at 10am as DHHS notification.
• Youth medical refusal form was reviewed and documents
Youth A’s refusal of medical attention for the broken tooth.
Video Footage Reviewed:
• Video footage dated 3/3/25 shows Youth A standing still
near Youth E when Youth F approaches and punches him
in the mouth and walking away. Staff were viewed to be
standing in close proximity as described by interviews.
Once Youth F struck Youth E and walked away staff were
viewed to disperse to tend to Youth E and address Youth F.
Analysis There is no rule violation found regarding this allegation. Per staff
and nurse interviews Youth A was offered medical attention and
Youth A refused to be taken to Urgent Care. Further, Incident
Report dated 3/3/25 states that Youth A was offered medical care
and transportation to Urgent Care and refused to go.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150 Incident reporting.
Section (1) Any incident resulting in serious injury of a resident or illness
Description requiring inpatient hospitalization, shall be reported to the parent/
legal guardian, responsible referring agency, and the licensing
4

authority as soon as possible, but not more than 24 hours after the
incident.
Violation Additional Allegation
Type
Allegation The facility failed to timely notify MDHHS of the assault and injury.
Investigation Foster Care Worker was contacted via phone on 3/5/2025. As
indicated above, Foster Care Worker stated that a phone call was
held with Staff 2 on 3/4/25 during which time it was not disclosed
that Youth A was assaulted.
Complainant was contacted via phone on 3/5/2025. Complainant
did not provide any additional information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. As indicated above Staff 1 did not
have information regarding the reporting of the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 4/4/25. As indicated above
Staff 2 reported that all critical incidences are reported within 24
hours through MiSACWIS. Staff 2 reported that she contacted the
Foster Care Worker on 3/4/25 via phone and at that time reported
the assault and the AWOL. Staff 2 reported during the phone
conversation it was reported to the Foster Care Worker that Youth
A’s tooth was knocked out and that Youth A was refusing medical
care. Staff 2 reported that an incident report was completed and
entered into MISACWIS regarding the AWOL and regarding the
assault. Staff 2 reported they have 24 hours to input critical
incidents and that she sends emails or makes phone calls to the
Foster Care Worker as soon as possible.
Staff 3 and Staff 4 were interviewed separately via phone on
4/4/2025. Neither staff had any information about the reporting of
the incident.
Nurse was interviewed via phone on 4/8/2025. As indicated above
Nurse reported that Nurse reported that Youth A signed the
necessary document refusing medical care after a long discussion
and several attempts to encourage him to go. Nurse did not have
any knowledge of any other reporting that was done.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Critical Incident Response and Reporting Policy. Policy
states that physical injury and AWOL incidents are
considered Critical Incidents. Policy states that reporting to
MDHHS is required within 24 hours.
5

• Incident Report dated 3/3/2025 documents that Youth F
assaulted Youth A by striking him in the face, causing his
tooth to be broken. Incident Report documents Youth A
refusing to go to urgent care. Incident report documents
contact at 3/4/25 at 10am as DHHS notification. Incident
report states that Youth A requested to call his foster care
worker after 6:00pm.
Analysis There is no violation found regarding this allegation. It was
reported by both the Foster Care Worker and Staff 2 that a phone
conversation occurred between them on 3/4/25. Staff 2 reported
that the assault and refusal of medical care was disclosed at that
time. Although the Foster Care Worker alleges that this disclosure
did not occur, there is insufficient evidence of a rule violation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4124 Communication.
Section Rule 124. An institution shall have and follow a written policy
Description regarding communication that ensures that a child is able to
communicate with family and friends in a manner appropriate to
the child’s functioning and consistent with the child’s treatment
plan and security level.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A requested to call his foster care worker and was denied.
Investigation Complainant was contacted via phone on 3/5/2025. Complainant
did not provide any additional information regarding this allegation.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Staff 1 reported he had no
knowledge that Youth A asked to call his foster care worker or that
he was told that he could not.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Youth B did not have knowledge if
Youth A requested to call his Foster Care Worker.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Youth D did not hear Youth A
request to call his worker.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with the
MDHHS Specialist on 3/13/25. Youth E reported he did not know if
Youth A requested to call his foster care worker.
6

Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 4/4/25. Staff 2 reported that
she had no knowledge of Youth A requesting to call his foster care
worker or being told no.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 4/4/2025. Staff 3 reported
he did not know if Youth A requested to call his foster care worker
and was denied.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 4/4/2025. Staff 4 reported
she did not hear Youth A request to call his foster care worker at
any time or that he was denied.
Nurse was interviewed via phone on 4/8/2025. Nurse denied that
during their discussion Youth A requested to call his Foster Care
Worker and denied any knowledge of Youth A asking anyone else
to call and being denied.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 3/3/2025 documents that Youth A
requested to call his foster care worker after 6:00pm. It was
noted on the incident report that Youth A was directed to
request a call to his foster care worker through his case
manager during the foster care worker’s working hours. It is
also noted that Youth A was able to speak with his
therapist.
Analysis There is no rule violation found regarding this allegation. Per the
Incident Report Youth A requested to call his worker after 6:20pm
which is after a Foster Care Worker’s working hours therefore he
was told he would have to request the call in the typical manner
during working hours the next day. Further, it is documented that
during this timeframe, Youth A was able to speak with his
therapist. Per Staff and Nurse interviews a Youth will request to
speak with their Foster Care Worker through the facility’s clinical
department who are tasked with arranging those contacts during
working hours.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
